Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Tokyo I was invited to speak at a conference at the nearby convention center. The conference put me up at this hotel. Their choice was excellent. My balcony overlooked the beautiful Tokyo Bay. The room was impeccably clean. The staff was superb. It is easy to get to downtown on the train from the station adjacent to the hotel. The nearby restaurants are fine.
Reviews.Author: CraigAWashDC

Reviews.Content: Great for short stays Spent 6 nights at the Nikko Tokyo - if this is your first trip to japan this is a very good start as it is clean, comfortable and the staff speak good English. The location is in the Odaiba area, so a little out of the way but Japan's excellent rail system gets you into the heart of Tokyo in well under half and hour. You do get what you pay for, a large spacious room, attentive staff and excellent service. The spa is also good but a little expensive.On the downside, they are extremely strict about no one checking in before 3pm, which is up to them, but can be very annoying if you haven't slept in 36 hours, are desperate for a bed and it's 2:55pm! The restaurants inside the hotel are overpriced but there are loads of quality restaurants within 5 mins walk from the hotel. Also, be careful making phone calls, when we checked-out we had a nasty shock with the phone bill - they charged us nearly 拢45 for a 9 minute phonecall to the UK made in the middle of the night. Overall this is a great hotel and I would recommend it for anyone who does not want to stay in one of the other very busy areas of Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: BondGirl78

Reviews.Content: A relaxing haven I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Tokyo - particularly for the first time. Don't be put off by the fact that it is in Odaiba. This is actually a plus as the Hotel Nikko is a perfect escape from the frantic pace of downtown Tokyo. At the end of our trip, we stayed one night in a hotel in Shinjinku and much prefered Odaiba. The monorail is very easy to use with English instructions on the ticket machines. The hotel itself is exactly what you would expect from a large, top-class hotel such as this with all of the usual amenities and services. We didn't eat in the hotel but instead tried the various places nearby. If possible, book a bay view room as the view across the river of Tokyo and the rainbow bridge is truely breathtaking. I'd also recommend going to the Odaiba Onsen Monogatari for an amazing Japanese spa experience (even if it is a spa theme park!). It's only two stops away from the Hotel Nikko on the monorail and is an excellent means of doing something very Japanese while still recovering from jetlag.
Reviews.Author: ALEXAJ

Reviews.Content: Unbelievable Stay Although we stayed here in February, I wanted to write a semi-quick review of this hotel since we might come back in July. First of all, the location is phenomenal; the monorail is literally a 30 second walk from the hotel, so you can get into the heart of Tokyo no problem. Now for the usual wows: the hotel was super clean (no wonder, it's Japan), the service severely friendly and helpful, the room with the jaw-dropping view and a sexy (and quite large) LCD TV with HD capability was very useful, and the stay overall was nostalgic. My wife and I highly recommend this hotel, which is located in one of the nicest regions of Tokyo (Odaiba). And I hope we'll be back there in July, I'll try to take some nice photos to post here. Cheers.
Reviews.Author: Yuri86

Reviews.Content: Good hotel The Nikko hotel will be a good choice in Tokyo for some but its not for everyone.Firstly I have to say they staff are fantastic, helfpul, friendly, polite - everything you need them to be.The hotel itself has a stunning lobby but the rooms are a little outdated and tired.I found it jut to be a bit too far away from everything. Its in Odaiba, a man made island, a mile or two away from the biz. on the plus side there's a monorail right outside that takes you to Shiodome or Shimbashi and that was great but added 20 mins to get places.Having said all this, I did enjoy my stay, but would stay somewhere a little closer to the action and more contemporary next time.
Reviews.Author: MistyLaw2

Reviews.Content: The Best Hotel in Odaiba       Room and TV
Reviews.Author: Chummy

Reviews.Content: Loved the Nikko Hotel - romantic, elegant hotel with great service! Sorry for posting this review only 4 months after my stay at Nikko Hotel. I simply forgot... I stayed there for a training event last Dec. The hotel was decorated for Christmas and with its breathtaking view of the Rainbow Bridge, it was wonderful.I was on the Executive Floor and the room didn't appear old to me (quite contrary to what another reviewer said). It wasn't brand new but well kept. The room was also huge and well appointed. There was also a little balcony and I remember stepping out to take pics of the rainbow bridge. Most rooms have a view of the bridge.The hotel is also located right next to malls in Odaiba, and even the restaurants there offer great views of the area. Plenty of things to do there.I don't recommend this hotel if you are not planning to spend 1 or 2 days at the Disneyland or other Odaiba theme parks. Though the hotel is directly linked to the train station, it will take you 45 mins to an hour to reach Tokyo's city centre. I tried that myself. It's great for holidaymakers or honeymooners!
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers

Reviews.Content: Great experience here! We were primarily going to Tokyo to see Disneyland Tokyo and Disney Sea during cherry blossom time/spring holiday. All Disney Hotels or Disney partner hotels closer to Disneyland were booked or extremely expensive. VERY reasonable price for 4 nights here through expedia. Shuttle bus (20 minutes) to and from Disneyland is available. If shuttle is full or you want to leave at different times, very easy metro connections from Disney to hotel. Location was ideal for us. Fantasic harbor view of rainbow bridge and Tokyo. Corner room with balcony was very spacious, comfortable king sized bed, room was extremely clean and well maintained. Very pleasant staff with good English skills. Shopping centers and many restuarants close by. Easy ride to Shimbashi station by Yurikamome monorail. We also visited Ginza, Ueno and Asakusa areas from here using metro - no big deal to get into Tokyo. Airport express bus available to/from Narita airport. If you want to feel like you are in downtownTokyo and want all of the crowds and noise, then don't stay here - it's peaceful and quite. A friend who lives in Tokyo said all the young people who want to get away fromTokyo for the weekend come over to Odaiba (reclaimed island on which hotel Nikko is located). Downside - hotel restaurants very expensive - but many alternatives within walking distance. Shopping centers and restaurants can be quite packed during summer weekends.
Reviews.Author: JackR46

Reviews.Content: Go Elsewhere The hotel is old. Furnishings and rooms are old. When we checked in, they wanted to give us a smoking room even though our reservations were for non-smoking. Location of the hotel is seriously out of the way. To get from Daiba (Yurikamome line) to any subway line would cost 310Yen. Aside the fact it took about 25mins. Would not recommend this hotel. Plus side, customer service is good, when we complained, they upgraded us to another room. Same issue, the rooms are old and the hotel requires refurbishment. Great views from the window of the bridge and stunning views at night.
Reviews.Author: archmage

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Rainbow Bridge view       View from the room
Reviews.Author: yrtx4e

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Outstanding Staff We stayed at the Nikko in odaiba for 10 days in july. we were there during a typhoon and an earthquake and it couldn't have been better. The staff and the facilities were outstanding. the location was great. a great view of downtown tokyo but out of the hussle and bussle, but only 10 minutes by monorail away. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.
Reviews.Author: JBRENTJ

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value on Tokyo Bay Location: Very convenient to getting around, even though it is in the newly developed area on Tokyo Bay-- Adjacent to Yurikamome Monorail, Daiba Station -- Y310 to get to Shimbashi Station and connect to major lines (e.g., get the Yokohama, Kamakura, etc.) or an easy walk to Ginza. There is also the Suidobasu (river boat) at Hinode Pier, several stops from Daiba, where you can take the waterbus to Asakusa Pier and walk to Kaminarimon/Asakusa Temple. Lots of places to eat within in 2-5 minutes walk from the hotel (Aqua City, with shops and places to eat), McDonalds, Starbucks, sushi, noodles, etc.Comfort: Very comfortable -- rooms have views of the water, Tokyo skyline, well appointed, super clean, deep and long bath tub, robes and pajamas which are provided daily, toiletries amply replenished. Stock your own water, snacks as the mini bar items are pricey. At Shimbashi Station there is a great grocer where you can purchase just about everything (produce, drinks, bento, bakery items and prepared bentos) to bring back to your room should you wish.Although you can get to Asakusa by train, the water bus on a clear day is a great way to take in the city. Although we took a cab from Haneda (about 20 minutes to the hotel Y4500 or so), there is an airport bus from there as well as the Narita Airport bus y2700 which leaves directly from the hotel (and the hotel staff are terrific about keeping your bags and getting it on the airport bus). Overall, a beautiful setting (so many weddings on the weekend) for a moderate price (do spring for the differential for the water view room as it is worth it), a lovely central staircase in the lobby, a fish tank, service was very courteous, use of the business center, i.e., the computers and internet access was without charge . . . and they kept me posted on the game 4 Red Sox win!!!
Reviews.Author: pakalana

Reviews.Content: Best Hotel In Tokyo A centally located 5 star hotel located on the Metro Line Outside busy Tokyo City only 20min from Ginza across the Rainbow Bridge. Excellent panormaric views of the picture postcard Tokyo Bay. View scenery from your private balcony. Service is excellent and staff friendly and hospitable. All spoke English. Food is varied with international cuisine from French to Japanese cuisine and will cook anything you wish for which may not be on the menu. Rooms are large and has excellent facilities. For a single person travelling, you are not housed in a shoe box with a single bed as is the norm in most Japanese Hotels. Popular for weekend weddings. Shops and restraunts close by. Good venue with conference facilities. The IATA International Conference was held there last week.
Reviews.Author: Aussyjonsey

Reviews.Content: Wonderful American-style hotel I stayed at the Nikko for a business function for over a week. Although the location is a bit further away from Tokyo proper, necessitating an additional tram ride, the hotel itself is wonderful. The rooms were very spacious, extremely clean and well maintained. When I got back to the hotel one night after work, the staff took it upon themselves to move me to another room (upgrade) due to the cleaning staff's observance of a crack on the outside of the bathtub. The room service and meals were excellent. I would love to stay here again.
Reviews.Author: LuxTravel
